actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: A bill to amend Section 119 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that meals furnished by an employer to an employee may be considered furnished for the convenience of the employer if the meals are furnished on the business premises of the employer generally, except under certain conditions whereby meals may be furnished off the business premises of the employer.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend the income tax exclusion for the cost of meals furnished by an employer to meals furnished off the business premises of the employer. Requires that such meals be furnished in kind and be furnished within a time frame consistent with the employer's established meal schedule.

titles.title: A bill to amend Section 119 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that meals furnished by an employer to an employee may be considered furnished for the convenience of the employer if the meals are furnished on the business premises of the employer generally, except under certain conditions whereby meals may be furnished off the business premises of the employer.
